conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source, casting A, B, C and D on the ground.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will change in both position and size.
As the light source moves downward, the shadows will move away from the light source.
A, B, C, and D will shift further from the objects casting them.
The size of the shadows will increase.
The angle of the light source relative to the objects becomes more acute, causing the shadows to stretch out more.
The direction of the movement of the shadows will depend on the direction of the light source's movement.
Since the light source is moving downward, the shadows will move in the opposite direction, which is upward in the image.
The relative positioning of the shadows to each other will also change.
Shadows that are closer to the light source will move less than those that are farther away, creating a staggered effect.
The length of the shadows will increase.

As the light source moves downward, the shadows A, B, C, and D will move upward and away from the objects, increase in size, and the relative positioning between the shadows will change, with the shadows closer to the light source moving less than those farther away.
